item.name: Search for a patient

request.description: Example of a "birthdate" range test (ge2010-10-21 & le2010-10-23)  will return a single result with a "birthdate" = 2010-10-22

Example of a simple search including email using minimum search parameters ("family" name, "gender" & "date of birth" & "email") will return a single result.

item.name: Fuzzy search including phone and email

request.description: HTTP Status 200 with single search result.
Example error caused by providing `birthdate` query param in an invalid format
Example of a wildcarded search, where the "family" name is wildcarded, will return a result of 2 patients - Jane Smith patient (nhsId - 9000000009) & Jayne Smith (nhsId - 9000000017)
Example of a wildcarded search, where the "family" name is wildcarded, when phone is included will return 1 patient - Jane Smith patient (nhsId - 9000000009)
Example of a wildcarded search, where the "family" name is wildcarded, when email is included will return 1 patient - Jane Smith patient (nhsId - 9000000009)
Example of a search that is valid, but returns no results

Example of a wildcarded search with limited results, where the "family" name is wildcarded and "_max-results" is added, which limits the number of results to 2 patients - will return a result of 2 patients - Jane Smith patient (nhsId - 9000000009) & Jayne Smith (nhsId - 9000000017)

Note: if "_max-results" is reduced to 1 then a "TOO_MANY_RESULTS" error response will be returned, as the number of matched patients found is greater than the "_max-results" parameter.

item.name: Search with limited results inc phone

request.description: Example of a wildcarded search with limited results, where the "family" name is wildcarded and "_max-results" is added, but adding phone/email should only return 1 result, so "_max-results" is superfluous in this case

item.name: Search with limited results inc phone

request.description: Example of a wildcarded search with limited results, where the "family" name is wildcarded and "_max-results" is added, but adding phone/email should only return 1 result, so "_max-results" is superfluous in this case

Example of a search for a patient with restricted data - will return a patient with restricted data, e.g. address & telecom will not be returned and the meta.security.code object will be "R", representing a restricted patient.

item.description:
In this folder you will find examples of using the PATCH method to update a patient's record.

When you execute a successful scenario the response will return an updated patient record that looks like the patient has been updated with the changes you made. However, your changes will not be persisted in the sandbox environment, meaning if you perform a subsequent retrieve on the patient the record returned will hold the original patient data.

JSON Patch operations themselves are validated, but the resulting resource is not validated for correctness, e.g business rules are not validated.

In order to perform a successful patch and see the update on the patient, each Valid Update test comprises of 1 request:

1. Patch Request - will result in a 200 response with the outcome of the updated patient record.

Whilst there are only 3 Valid Update scenarios scoped in the pack it is possible to add further update scenarios to perform patches on other attributes such as Addresses, Telecoms, Contact Preferences etc.

request.description: Attempt to Patch a patient with an invalid patch operation, e.g. the path for the name instance is incorrect, results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch for an invalid NHS number, results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch a patient that doesn't exist (but providing a valid NHS number), results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch a patient with no patch submitted, results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch where the If-Match Header contains the incorrect version of the patient record, results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch where the Content-Type header is incorrect, results in an error response.
Attempt to Patch where the If-Match Header is missing, results in an error response.
